section.title: Description
section.p: Doxygen is a source code documentation tool. It uses special formatted comments in the source code to generate a complete documentation in several different formats. In BUSMASTER only HTML output is generated.
The doxygen manual is available at: .

section.title: Download
section.p: Doxygen is available at . In the blue box on the right side is a "Download" link. Download the latest installer available, e.g. doxygen-1.7.5.1-setup.exe (2011-10-25).

section.title: Installation
section.p: Execute doxygen-1.7.5.1-setup.exe to install the application. The standard installation folder is %ProgramFiles%\doxygen. It will also be added to the %PATH% environment variable.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: Doxygen requires no specific configuration beside the files provided in the BUSMASTER\Documents\5 Source Code Documentation\Doxyfiles\*.
It is helpful to add Doxygen to the list of external tools in the tools menu within the Visual C++ IDE.

section.title: Usage
section.p: BUSMASTER comes with a build.bat script that automatically calls Doxygen in the right way. However if doxygen is not in your %PATH% environment variable you need to adjust the script accordingly. After running Doxygen the output for each module is placed in the folder Documents\5 Source Code Documentation\out. An index.html is provided as convenient entry point to the generated documentations.
The preferred Doxygen file header contains:
section.codeblock: /** * \file <filename> * \brief <brief description> * \author <author> [if there is only one author] * \authors <author 1>, <author 2>, ... [if there are multiple authors] * \copyright Copyright (c) 2011, Robert Bosch Engineering * and Business Solutions. All rights reserved. * * <long description> */
section.p: The preferred Doxygen function header contains:
section.codeblock: /** * \brief <brief description> * \param[in] <param name> <description> [if thats inbound] * \param[out] <param name> <description> [if thats outbound] * \param[in,out] <param name> <description> [if thats in- and outbound] * \param <param name> <description> [if direction is unspecified] * \return <description> * * <long description> */ <return type> foobar(<param type> <param name>, ...)
